title: VPSRAVW/VPSRAVD/VPSRAVQ â€” Variable Bit Shift Right Arithmetic

fields.name: Instruction Modes
fields.value:
`VPSRAVD xmm1, xmm2, xmm3/m128`
`VPSRAVD ymm1, ymm2, ymm3/m256`
`VPSRAVW xmm1 {k1}{z}, xmm2, xmm3/m128`
`VPSRAVW ymm1 {k1}{z}, ymm2, ymm3/m256`
`VPSRAVW zmm1 {k1}{z}, zmm2, zmm3/m512`
`VPSRAVD xmm1 {k1}{z}, xmm2, xmm3/m128/m32bcst`
`VPSRAVD ymm1 {k1}{z}, ymm2, ymm3/m256/m32bcst`
`VPSRAVD zmm1 {k1}{z}, zmm2, zmm3/m512/m32bcst`
`VPSRAVQ xmm1 {k1}{z}, xmm2, xmm3/m128/m64bcst`
`VPSRAVQ ymm1 {k1}{z}, ymm2, ymm3/m256/m64bcst`
`VPSRAVQ zmm1 {k1}{z}, zmm2, zmm3/m512/m64bcst`

fields.name: Description
fields.value: Shifts the bits in the individual data elements (word/doublewords/quadword) in the first source operand (the second operand) to the right by the number of bits specified in the count value of respective data elements in the second source operand (the third operand). As the bits in the data elements are shifted right, the empty high-order bits are set to the MSB (sign extension).

fields.name: ​
fields.value: The count values are specified individually in each data element of the second source operand. If the unsigned integer value specified in the respective data element of the second source operand is greater than 15 (for words), 31 (for doublewords), or 63 (for a quadword), then the destination data element is filled with the corresponding sign bit of the source element.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: VEX.128 encoded version: The destination and first source operands are XMM registers. The count operand can be either an XMM register or a 128-bit memory location. Bits (MAXVL-1:128) of the corresponding destination register are zeroed.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: VEX.256 encoded version: The destination and first source operands are YMM registers. The count operand can be either an YMM register or a 256-bit memory. Bits (MAXVL-1:256) of the corresponding destination register are zeroed.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: EVEX.512/256/128 encoded VPSRAVD/W: The destination and first source operands are ZMM/YMM/XMM registers. The count operand can be either a ZMM/YMM/XMM register, a 512/256/128-bit memory location or a 512/256/128-bit vector broadcasted from a 32/64-bit memory location. The destination is conditionally updated with writemask k1.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: EVEX.512/256/128 encoded VPSRAVQ: The destination and first source operands are ZMM/YMM/XMM registers. The count operand can be either a ZMM/YMM/XMM register, a 512/256/128-bit memory location. The destination is conditionally updated with writemask k1.
